intro: Tithymalopsis exserta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tithymalopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Tithymalopsis exserta is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
